# Elk County Courthouse (Howard, Kansas)

| locmapin = Kansas#USA
| built = 1907
| architect =George E. McDonald
|builder=Morse Contracting
| architecture = Renaissance
| added = April 22, 2009
| area =
| mpsub = County Courthouses of Kansas MPS
| refnum = 09000227
}}
The Elk County Courthouse, located at 127 N. Pine in Howard in Elk County, Kansas, was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2009.
Architect George E. McDonald designed the brick building with elements of Richardsonian Romanesque and Italian Renaissance Revival style.  It was built by Topeka's Morse Contracting in 1907.  It is approximately  in plan, and is two stories upon a raised basement.  The brick exterior is yellow/buff in color, with the bottom level finished in rusticated limestone.|title=National Register of Historic Places Registration: Elk County Courthouse / 049-2570-0002 |publisher=National Park Service|author=Michael L. West |date=November 7, 2008 |accessdate=October 25, 2017}}
McDonald designed three other courthouses listed on the National Register.
